def.dt: :in or into a state of awareness about put me onto your methods

dt.un: used as a function word to indicate a set each element of which is the image of at least one element of another set a function mapping the set S onto the set T

def.dt: :mapping elements in such a way that every element in one set is the image of at least one element in another set a function that is one-to-one and onto

entry.et: alteration of English dialect glaum to grab

def.dt: :to grab hold of :appropriate to oneself glommed on to her ideas
:to persist tenaciously a cold that hung on all spring
:to maintain a grasp on something :hang on
:to await something (as a telephone connection) desired or requested
:to maintain possession of or adherence to
:to make fast with or as if with a lock lock up the house
:to fasten in or out or to make secure or inaccessible by or as if by means of locks locked himself away from the curious world
:to fix in a particular situation or method of operation a team firmly locked in last place
:to make fast, motionless, or inflexible especially by the interlacing or interlocking of parts lock wheels lock a knee
:to bind closely administration and students were locked in conflict
:to invest (capital) without assurance of easy convertibility into money
:to move or permit to pass (as a ship) by raising or lowering in a lock
:to go or pass by means of a lock (as in a canal)
:to acquire (as a target or signal) automatically using a sensor (as radar)

entry.et: New Latin, from Late Greek, from Greek ont-, ōn, present participle of einai to be is
